answers.answer: My mom had preeclampsia with all four pregnancies, it's not hereditary. But swelling could be caused my lack of water. Try keeping your feet up and drink lots of water. Technically we should be drinking up to 132 oz a day! Lol
I've been swelling since 24 w off and on and do not have preclampsia. You just need to up your water and watch your sodium intake
I feel like I drink a lot of water, but I guess maybe not enough. I'll work on that more. Thanks!

I've had problems with swelling in my ankles from 20wks till now (23wks). It only seems to happen when I'm sitting at my desk at work. It's also been very hot here lately which I'm sure is related. I just try to elevate my feet when I can and drink a lot of water. It'll usually go away by morning but boy is it irritating!
Ive been the same but started 2days ago w.my hands .

question: I'm 27 weeks today and my hands and feel have been swelling pretty bad for the last couple weeks. I know swelling is common in pregnancy, but is it common this early? I've heard that major swelling can be a possible sign of preeclampsea. My mom had preeclampsea when she had me and i was born 2 months early so i dont want to take any chances. I have an appointment with my doctor on Monday and will be talking to them about it, I just want to know if anyone else dealt with swelling this early?
title: Swelling question
